page.title: 03MINERS WELFARE SERVICES
page.content: Welfare services connected with the colliery have always played a major part in the life of Creswell. The Bolsover Colliery Company built Creswell Model Village in 1897. This provided housing for the miners which was within a few hundred metres of the colliery. This housing has been recently modernised, financed by grants from the Government, the N.C.B. and a loan from the E.E.C. Activities in the Miners' Welfare Scheme include cricket, football, bowls and a brass band. There is also an active St. John's Ambulance Brigade Division, which, including boy and girl cadets, numbers 150.
